title: One dead and multiple stabbings in Cornish holiday resort
body_text:
A murder inquiry has been launched after multiple people were stabbed in the Cornish holiday town of Bodmin. Locals said this morning that cordons had been put in place and there was a heavy police presence.
Police are currently near the Eclipse Nightclub on Castle Canyke Road and are believed to have been there since the early hours of this morning.
A witness said there were forensic tents outside the nightclub. The road is closed at the entrance to Victoria Square. A football match planned on a nearby pitch was cancelled this morning, according to locals, reports Cornwall Live.
READ NEXT Man dies after being found in street
Police have now confirmed that a murder inquiry is underway. A statement said: "Police were called at 3.15am on Sunday 30 April to the area of Victoria Square on Castle Canyke Road following a report of a serious altercation.
"It was further reported that someone was in possession of a knife and that multiple people had sustained suspected stab wounds.
"A man in his 30s was confirmed deceased at the scene. His next of kin have been informed and are being supported by specialist officers.
"At least seven other men and women have been injured and taken to hospital to receive treatment. At this time none are being treated as life-threatening.
"A 24-year-old man from Bodmin has been arrested on suspicion of murder, attempted murder and causing grievous bodily harm with intent. He remains in police custody at this time."
Leigh Frost, Cornwall Councillor for Bodmin St Petroc, said on Facebook this morning: "Many of you are aware of the awful tragic news that has happened on Castle Canyke Road last night. The police are on the scene and access to the road is closed. At the moment I strongly urge everyone to let the professionals do their jobs and keep the speculation to a minimum. My thoughts are with the victims and their families."

Tributes paid to Mike Allen
The victim of a suspected knife attack near Eclipse Nightclub in Bodmin has been named as 36-year-old Michael 'Mike' Allen. Tributes have been paid by his family who have described him as being a 'much loved' dog lover and rugby enthusiast who lived in the town. Read the full story here.
Road still closed
The road is still closed this morning, according to traffic and travel service Inrix.
Officers responding to reports of multiple stabbings outside a Cornwall nightclub discovered a 'traumatic' scene according to the local police superintendent.
Castle Canyke Road remains closed
Inrix reports: "Castle Canyke Road in both directions closed due to police incident between Omaha Road and B3268 St Nicholas Street."
One dead, multiple injured and man arrested in Bodmin
A man in his 30s was found deceased in the early hours of this morning and at least seven people have been taken to hospital after a man was suspected to have been in possession of a knife in the Victoria Square area of Bodmin. A 24-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of murder as well as attempted murder and causing grievous bodily harm with intent.
Read the full story here.
Police give statement
Police have now released a statement.
It reads as follows:
Police were called at 3.15am on Sunday 30 April to the area of Victoria Square on Castle Canyke Road following a report of a serious altercation.
It was further reported that someone was in possession of a knife and that multiple people had sustained suspected stab wounds.
A man in his 30s was confirmed deceased at the scene. His next of kin have been informed and are being supported by specialist officers.
At least seven other men and women have been injured and taken to hospital to receive treatment. At this time none are being treated as life-threatening.
A 24-year-old man from Bodmin has been arrested on suspicion of murder, attempted murder and causing grievous bodily harm with intent. He remains in police custody at this time.
Detective Inspector Ilona Rosson from the Major Crime Investigation Team said: “Following an incident in Bodmin last night, a man in his 30s has been confirmed deceased and officers are supporting his next of kin.
“At this time we are treating this as an isolated matter and we are not seeking anyone else in connection to this incident.
“This is a live and active police investigation, and I would urge people not to speculate on social media but if you have information which may assist us, please report it.”
East Cornwall Local Policing Superintendent, Rob Youngman said: “This investigation is in its early stages and the public can expect to see a heightened policing presence around Bodmin today whilst enquiries are ongoing.
“Understandably this incident will have an impact on the local community, and our thoughts are with the families of the victims.
“Cordons will stay in place today whilst officers gather information and evidence from the scene.
“Anyone who has not yet been spoken to by officers and has any information which may assist our investigation, please get in touch. This could include any relevant dash-cam, doorbell and CCTV footage from the area of Victoria Square and along Castle Canyke Road.”
If you witnessed the incident or have any information, including footage that could help with enquiries, please contact police via the Major Incident Public Portal: ADD MIPP LINK
Nearby football pitch closed
Colharbour Football Ground on Castle Canyke Road in Bodmin has been closed due to a "serious incident".
Bodmin Youth FC said in a Facebook post: "Due to a serious incident in the local vicinity, Coldharbour is closed today, 30th April.
"If you have a home game scheduled, please be sure to check-in with your respective team manager/coach through your usual channels".
